segment.source: Microsoft will provide update packages to Windows 10 that need to be installed on your customized Windows images.
segment.target: Microsoft will provide update packages to Windows 10 that need to be installed on your customized Windows images.

segment.source: Add the zero-day package (ZDP) to your existing Windows 10 images to provide your users with the latest updates.
segment.target: Add the zero-day package (ZDP) to your existing Windows 10 images to provide your users with the latest updates.

segment.source: Add updates to customized Windows images
segment.target: Add updates to customized Windows images

segment.source: Add updates to customized Windows images
segment.target: Add updates to customized Windows images

segment.source: Microsoft will provide update packages to Windows 10 that need to be installed on your customized Windows images.
segment.target: Microsoft will provide update packages to Windows 10 that need to be installed on your customized Windows images.

segment.source: Add the zero-day package (ZDP) to your existing Windows 10 images to provide your users with the latest updates.
segment.target: Add the zero-day package (ZDP) to your existing Windows 10 images to provide your users with the latest updates.

segment.source: This topic describes how to install the ZDP to a Windows image, in addition to any other update that Microsoft releases for Windows 10.
segment.target: This topic describes how to install the ZDP to a Windows image, in addition to any other update that Microsoft releases for Windows 10.

segment.source: The ZDP update is a rollup of all of the updates released between Windows 10 build 10240 and today.
segment.target: The ZDP update is a rollup of all of the updates released between Windows 10 build 10240 and today.

segment.source: Note As of August 8th, 2015:
segment.target: Note As of August 8th, 2015:

segment.source: Use the Windows PE and Windows RE versions from the ADK build 10240.
segment.target: Use the Windows PE and Windows RE versions from the ADK build 10240.

segment.source: Don't update the version of Windows PE or Windows RE unless otherwise instructed.
segment.target: Don't update the version of Windows PE or Windows RE unless otherwise instructed.

segment.source: Do not use /ResetBase (DISM /Cleanup-Image /ResetBase) after applying the ZDP offline.
segment.target: Do not use /ResetBase (DISM /Cleanup-Image /ResetBase) after applying the ZDP offline.

segment.source: The ZDP has pending actions, which must be completed before running /ResetBase.
segment.target: The ZDP has pending actions, which must be completed before running /ResetBase.

segment.source: You can't just add the ZDP into an unattended setup answer file - you must update the entire image before installing it.
segment.target: You can't just add the ZDP into an unattended setup answer file - you must update the entire image before installing it.

segment.source: Start with your customized image
segment.target: Start with your customized image

segment.source: Start with your existing customized Windows image with Windows 10 build 10240.
segment.target: Start with your existing customized Windows image with Windows 10 build 10240.

segment.source: Consider adding language packs before you add the ZDP updates – it may save you time later.
segment.target: Consider adding language packs before you add the ZDP updates – it may save you time later.

segment.source: To learn more, see the notes at the end of this topic and Add Language Packs to Windows.
segment.target: To learn more, see the notes at the end of this topic and Add Language Packs to Windows.

segment.source: Download the ZDP
segment.target: Download the ZDP

segment.source: Download the latest updates.
segment.target: Download the latest updates.

segment.source: Note, the ZDP is a cumulative update, so you'll only need to get the latest update package.
segment.target: Note, the ZDP is a cumulative update, so you'll only need to get the latest update package.

segment.source: Windows 10 64-bit version: http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=619271.
segment.target: Windows 10 64-bit version: http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=619271.

segment.source: Windows 10 32-bit version: http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=619272.
segment.target: Windows 10 32-bit version: http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=619272.

segment.source: Update your images
segment.target: Update your images

segment.source: From your technician PC, click Start, and type deployment.
segment.target: From your technician PC, click Start, and type deployment.

segment.source: Right-click Deployment and Imaging Tools Environment and then select Run as administrator.
segment.target: Right-click Deployment and Imaging Tools Environment and then select Run as administrator.

segment.source: Create a mount directory for your Windows image (install.wim), and then mount the image.
segment.target: Create a mount directory for your Windows image (install.wim), and then mount the image.

segment.source: Update your Windows images with the latest ZDP.
segment.target: Update your Windows images with the latest ZDP.

segment.source: Example:
segment.target: Example:

segment.source: Where C:MSUWindows10-KBxxxxxxx-x64.msu is the most recent version of the ZDP available.
segment.target: Where C:MSUWindows10-KBxxxxxxx-x64.msu is the most recent version of the ZDP available.

segment.source: Unmount the Windows image.
segment.target: Unmount the Windows image.

segment.source: Recommended: Boot the image to complete the update process, and then clean up the image
segment.target: Recommended: Boot the image to complete the update process, and then clean up the image

segment.source: Boot a reference device to Windows PE.
segment.target: Boot a reference device to Windows PE.

segment.source: Press CTRL+SHIFT+F3 at the OOBE screens to enter audit mode.
segment.target: Press CTRL+SHIFT+F3 at the OOBE screens to enter audit mode.

segment.source: Open the Command Prompt as an administrator.
segment.target: Open the Command Prompt as an administrator.

segment.source: Clean up the Windows image.
segment.target: Clean up the Windows image.

segment.source: (It's OK to use /ResetBase now that the PC has been booted into audit mode.)
segment.target: (It's OK to use /ResetBase now that the PC has been booted into audit mode.)

segment.source: Note You won't be able to clean up your Windows image until after you've booted it.
segment.target: Note You won't be able to clean up your Windows image until after you've booted it.

segment.source: Use Sysprep to generalize and shut down the PC.
segment.target: Use Sysprep to generalize and shut down the PC.

segment.source: Boot the PC to Windows PE.
segment.target: Boot the PC to Windows PE.

segment.source: If the PC starts rebooting to Windows, you'll need to let it finish booting and then use Sysprep to generalize and shut down the PC again.
segment.target: If the PC starts rebooting to Windows, you'll need to let it finish booting and then use Sysprep to generalize and shut down the PC again.

segment.source: Create a temporary scratch directory for DISM on a physical drive, rather than the default Windows PE virtual drive, to avoid issues related to short file names.
segment.target: Create a temporary scratch directory for DISM on a physical drive, rather than the default Windows PE virtual drive, to avoid issues related to short file names.

segment.source: To prevent capturing the DISM logs in your image, choose a location that’s in your DISM Exclusion list, for example, inside C:Recycler.
segment.target: To prevent capturing the DISM logs in your image, choose a location that’s in your DISM Exclusion list, for example, inside C:Recycler.

segment.source: For more info, see DISM Configuration List and WimScript.ini Files.
segment.target: For more info, see DISM Configuration List and WimScript.ini Files.

segment.source: Recapture the Windows image.
segment.target: Recapture the Windows image.

segment.source: This captures the applied updates and removes any files that were marked as superseded during DISM /Cleanup-Image.
segment.target: This captures the applied updates and removes any files that were marked as superseded during DISM /Cleanup-Image.

segment.source: Save the file to a location on a USB drive or a network (example: N:Images), and give the image a name (example: "Enterprisex64 with ZDP KBxxxxxxx").
segment.target: Save the file to a location on a USB drive or a network (example: N:Images), and give the image a name (example: "Enterprisex64 with ZDP KBxxxxxxx").

segment.source: Update Windows Setup bootable media
segment.target: Update Windows Setup bootable media

segment.source: Copy your bootable media (DVDs or other bootable media for Windows Setup, Windows Deployment Services (WDS), or System Center) to a writable folder on your PC.
segment.target: Copy your bootable media (DVDs or other bootable media for Windows Setup, Windows Deployment Services (WDS), or System Center) to a writable folder on your PC.

segment.source: Mount the file: sourcesboot.wim.
segment.target: Mount the file: sourcesboot.wim.

segment.source: Add the ZDP.
segment.target: Add the ZDP.

segment.source: Where C:MSUWindows10-KBxxxxxxx-x64.msu is the most recent version of the ZDP available.
segment.target: Where C:MSUWindows10-KBxxxxxxx-x64.msu is the most recent version of the ZDP available.

segment.source: In Windows Explorer, navigate to the mounted image root folder and sort the list of files by Date modified.
segment.target: In Windows Explorer, navigate to the mounted image root folder and sort the list of files by Date modified.

segment.source: Copy everything that’s been recently modified (setup.exe, locale.nls, setupplatform.dll, setupplatform.exe, reagent.dll, and anything else that looks recently modified) to the root of the install media.
segment.target: Copy everything that’s been recently modified (setup.exe, locale.nls, setupplatform.dll, setupplatform.exe, reagent.dll, and anything else that looks recently modified) to the root of the install media.

segment.source: Unmount the boot.wim file.
segment.target: Unmount the boot.wim file.

segment.source: Create bootable media (DVDs or other bootable media for Windows Setup, Windows Deployment Services (WDS), or System Center) using the files.
segment.target: Create bootable media (DVDs or other bootable media for Windows Setup, Windows Deployment Services (WDS), or System Center) using the files.

segment.source: To learn more, see Windows Setup Technical Reference.
segment.target: To learn more, see Windows Setup Technical Reference.

segment.source: Adding languages after adding the ZDP or other rollup packages
segment.target: Adding languages after adding the ZDP or other rollup packages

segment.source: Ideally, you'll want to add all of your language packs and components before adding any ZDPs or Windows rollup packages.
segment.target: Ideally, you'll want to add all of your language packs and components before adding any ZDPs or Windows rollup packages.

segment.source: If you need to add language packs or language features on demand after installing the ZDP or other rollup package, you'll need to reapply the ZDP/rollup package afterwards.
segment.target: If you need to add language packs or language features on demand after installing the ZDP or other rollup package, you'll need to reapply the ZDP/rollup package afterwards.

segment.source: Otherwise, the Windows user experience might not be correctly localized, and users may be prompted to download the language resources from Windows Update.
segment.target: Otherwise, the Windows user experience might not be correctly localized, and users may be prompted to download the language resources from Windows Update.

segment.source: Sample script
segment.target: Sample script

segment.source: The following sample script modifies a given Windows image by adding all of the updates in a specific folder into the image.
segment.target: The following sample script modifies a given Windows image by adding all of the updates in a specific folder into the image.

segment.source: After adding the image, it cleans up the image.
segment.target: After adding the image, it cleans up the image.
